entry.title: YTD v4.4 Beta-6
entry.content:
A new beta for YouTube Downloader is available for download through the app itself, enabling the proper preference, or downloading directly the apk from HERE.

Please share any idea commenting below or join the discussion over XDA.

The changelog is the one from the previous beta:

 v4.4-beta-5 - Jul 22 2014
-----------------------------------
[x] configurable downloads queue
[x] option to invert dashboard's entries click menus
[x] auto-resume downloads paused due to network failure
[x] new FFmpeg build targeting non-NEON CPUs (i.e. Tegra devices)
[x] ability to send logcat to the developer via email
[x] added Croatian, Indonesian (WIP) and Norwegian (WIP) translations
[x] fixed dashboard rename with existing filename (thanks m0d)

It just integrates the patch from the stable v4.3.2, addressing another issue with encrypted signature videos.

entry.title: YTD v4.3.2
entry.content:
YouTube Downloader version 4.3.2 is available!
As always, download it from this blog or wait until will be available also through the selected app stores (see the app’s page).

Changelog:

 v4.3.2 - Jul 24 2014
-----------------------------------
[x] encrypted signature patch (10) (thanks gantt)

entry.title: YTD v4.4 Beta-5
entry.content:
A new beta for YouTube Downloader is available for download through the app itself, enabling the proper preference, or downloading directly the apk from [link removed – old beta].

Please share any idea commenting below or join the discussion over XDA.

Changelog:

 v4.4-beta-5 - Jul 22 2014
-----------------------------------
[x] configurable downloads queue
[x] option to invert dashboard's entries click menus
[x] auto-resume downloads paused due to network failure
[x] new FFmpeg build targeting non-NEON CPUs (i.e. Tegra devices)
[x] ability to send logcat to the developer via email
[x] added Croatian, Indonesian (WIP) and Norwegian (WIP) translations
[x] fixed dashboard rename with existing filename (thanks m0d)

entry.content:

As always, download it from this blog or wait until will be available also through the selected app stores (see the app’s page).

entry.title: New Beta Program (Again)
entry.content:
Seeing the extremely low “XDA acceptance ratio” of the latest beta distribution method, :–) I’m in the process to move from the Crashlytics distribution to an open method where beta versions will be available from the app itself.

Will be just a matter of switching a setting checkbox:

Please wait for a next update (v4.3.1) to have this feature.
